summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) regarding the 2020 trial calendar. It specifically mentions the upcoming trial of two Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) guards for falsifying records related to the night of Jeffrey Epstein's suicide.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email references the night he committed suicide while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Trial of MCC Guards (US v. Noel et al.)
events.description: Trial of two MCC guards for falsifying records and making false statements on prison documents to cover up their failure to perform their duties the night Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide
events.description: The night Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

keyFacts: The document is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York dated January 7, 2020.
It references a scheduled trial (US v. Noel et al.) for April 20, 2020, involving two MCC guards.
The guards were charged with falsifying records and making false statements to cover up their failure to perform duties on the night Jeffrey Epstein died.
The email confirms an ongoing legal proceeding directly related to the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death in custody.
All specific prosecutor (AUSA) and judge names are redacted in the provided text.
